WARNING! Many foods can be choking hazards for preschool-age children. Cut hard food into very thin, bite-size pieces before serving. Encourage your child to sit and chew their food well while under your watch.
Recipe is no longer a Favorite

You are now ready to use your vouchers!

Choose which vouchers you want to use to buy this item. Then choose how many.
Use these tools to calculate how much fruits and vegetables you can buy with each cash voucher.
Produce may be bought loose or in a package, fresh or frozen. Pick which type of fruit or vegetables you want to buy for the right calculator tool.
Not found in database. Please enter name of packaged fruit/vegetable item.
REMEMBER: Must not have added sugars, fats, oils, herbs or spices.

This is not a CASH item!
Please select a CASH voucher for this shopping trip!
1 large peach, peeled and sliced or 1/2 cup frozen peaches
1 (6 oz) carton low-fat yogurt, any flavor
1/2 ripe banana, sliced into bite-sized pieces
3 bananas, a little overripe or soft
1 container low-fat yogurt (6 oz), any flavor
1/4 small apple, cut into thin bite-sized pieces
2 fresh strawberries or 1/4 cup banana slices
1/2 pound carrots (baby carrots or carrots peeled and sliced into coins)
1/2 cup red apples, cut into small bite-sized pieces
1 inch of a whole cucumber, peeled and cut into very thin slices
2 long thin slices of cucumber, peeled
1 cup fresh or frozen fruit (strawberries, kiwi, peaches, blueberries work best!)
Handful of fresh spinach leaves, torn into small pieces
1/4 cup of guava or mango chunks
1/2 cup of pineapple cubes (fresh or frozen)
1/2 cup mango, peeled and cut into bite-size pieces
1/2 cup papaya, peeled, seeded, and cut into bite-size pieces
1/2 banana, peeled and sliced into bite-size pieces
1/2 cup pineapple, cut into bite-size pieces
1/4 cup mushrooms, cut into small pieces
Handful of fresh spinach leaves, torn into small pieces
1 medium sweet potato, washed and patted dry
6 carrot sticks or bell pepper strips, cut very thinly
1 leaf of lettuce, cut into triangles
1. Place all ingredients in a blender
Note: You can use bananas that are not frozen. The smoothie will not be as thick or cold, but just as delicious!
1. Place sliced bananas in cereal bowl
2. Pour milk over bananas and enjoy!
Variation: Cinnamon Slice-Up: Sprinkle banana slices with cinnamon before topping with milk
Variation: Berry and Banana Slice-Up: Add 1/4 cup sliced strawberries, rasberries, or other berries to bowl
1. Peel bananas and cut into slices
2. Place banana slices on a plate and freeze for 2 hours
3. Place frozen banana slices in blender and blend on high for 3 minutes; serve right away
Note: Bananas not blending? Add a splash of low-fat or skim milk!
1. Cover plate with plastic wrap or aluminum foil; set aside
2. Peel bananas; cut into small bite-sized pieces
3. Roll banana piece in yogurt, then roll in crushed cereal
4. Place banana pieces on plate and freeze until firm (about 1 hour)
5. Thaw banana pieces for a few minutes before serving
Child Serving: 1/4 - 1/2 cup frozen banana pieces
1. Slice an apple into thin bite-sized pieces
2. Place apple pieces on a plate and sprinkle with cinnamon
3. Cover plate with a paper towel
4. Microwave apples until they are soft (about 1 1/2 minutes).
Note: Apples will be HOT coming out of the microwave. Cool for a minute or two before serving!
Note: Apples can be a choking hazard if not chewed well. Peeling the apple and slicing it into small, thin pieces can help reduce the choking risk. Always monitor children when they\'re eating.
1. Place the tortilla on a plate
2. Place cheese on half the tortilla
3. Place the apple pieces over the cheese
5. Microwave on high until cheese is melted (about 30 seconds)
Note: The cheese in the tortilla stays HOT for a few minutes! Be sure to let the quesadilla cool before serving!
Note: Apples can be a choking hazard if not chewed well. Peeling the apple and slicing it into small, thin pieces can help reduce the choking risk. Always monitor children when theyre eating.
1. Rinse grapes under running water; remove from stem and pat dry
2. Cut each grape into 4 pieces; place grape pieces on a plate
4. Dip grape pieces in your favorite yogurt and enjoy!
1. Combine all ingredients in a blender
2. Blend until smooth and creamy; serve right away
1. Wash strawberries and cut off stems
2. Cut strawberries into bite-sized slices or pieces
3. Dip each strawberry slice into yogurt for a tasty and fun treat!
Child Serving: 2-4 medium strawberries with 1/4 cup yogurt
1. Put strawberries in a blender; mix until strawberries are broken up
2. Add milk and blend until smooth
3. Pour mixture into an ice tray and freeze until firm (about 2 hours)
4. Crush cubes in a bowl and eat with a spoon
2. Have your child smash the fruit with a fork (while supervised)
3. Spread a thin layer of peanut butter on the slice of bread
4. Top with the fruit smash and enjoy as an open face sandwich!
Note: Peanut butter can be a choking hazard for children because it\'s sticky. Be sure peanut butter is spread very thinly to keep your child safe! Always monitor young children when they\'re eating.
1. In a large microwave-safe dish, combine carrots and orange juice; cover the dish
2. Microwave on high until carrots are soft (about 5 minutes), stirring halfway through
3. Cool carrots for a few minutes and enjoy!
Note: Carrots will be HOT coming out of the microwave. Let carrots cool a little before serving!
Child Serving: 1/4 - 1/2 cup sweet carrot slaw
Note: Apples can be a choking hazard if not chewed well. Peeling the apple and slicing it into small, thin pieces can help reduce the choking risk. Always monitor children when they\'re eating.
1. Cut tomatoes into small bite-sized pieces
2. Mix all ingredients, stirring gently and enjoy!
Variations: Experiment with different herbs (like cilantro or basil) and spices (like cumin or cayenne) for a new, exciting salsa taste!
1. Cook the green beans according to the package instructions
2. In a large bowl, add cooked green beans and the remaining ingredients
Note: Be sure to cut green beans into bite-sized pieces for young children.
1. Spread a thin layer of cream cheese on slice of bread; slice bread in half
2. Top one half of the bread with cucumber slices; top with other half of bread
Note: Cream cheese can be a choking hazard for children because it\'s sticky. Be sure cream cheese is spread very thinly to keep your child safe! Always monitor children when they\'re eating.
1. Spread cream cheese on slice of bread
2. Spread a line of tuna on top of half of the cream cheese
3. Place long slices of cucumber in middle of bread
4. Roll bread lengthwise, making a roll
5. Slice rolled bread into thin "sushi" coins and serve!
1. Place fruit and juice in a blender, and mix until smooth
2. Fill ice cube tray with fruit mixture
4. Crush cubes in a bowl and eat with a spoon
1. Crack egg into a microwave safe cereal bowl; beat with fork
3. Microwave bowl on high for 30 seconds
4. Stir the scramble and microwave until cooked (10-15 seconds)
Note: Scramble will be HOT coming out of the microwave. Let scramble cool a minute or two before serving!
1. Cut avocado in half and twist; remove pit
2. With a spoon, scoop out the avocado pulp; place in a small bowl
3. Mash avocado with fork until almost smooth
4. Sprinkle with lime juice and salt; stir to combine
Note: Use a dip with your favorite veggies or as a spread for tasty sandwiches!
2. Cut avocado in half, remove pit, and scoop out the avocado pulp
3. Mash the avocado with a fork, and add a little lime juice
4. Spread avocado mash on top of toast
5. Slice toast into bite-sized pieces and enjoy!
1. Cut avocado in half, twist open, and remove pit
2. Fill the hole where the pit was with cottage cheese
3. Serve right away and eat with a spoon
Note: If spoons are too hard for your child to use, mash the avocado and mix it with the cottage cheese!
1. Peel chayote, remove seed from center, and cut into small bite-sized pieces
2. In a bowl, mix together oil, lime juice, salt, and pepper
3. Add chayote and cilantro to bowl and mix
4. Cover and refrigerate for 15-20 minutes before serving
1. If using, cut guava into chunks, with or without the seeds
2. Add all ingredients to a blender and mix until smooth
1. Wash the outside of the mango and dry
2. Cut around the mango pit, remove skin, and cut into small, bite-size pieces
3. Toss mango pieces with lime juice and cilantro
Variation: Add bite-sized pineapple pieces to this recipe for a different twist!
1. Wash and peel mango. Cut into squares around the pit, then remove the chunks from the pit.
2. Place mango chunks in blender and puree until smooth
3. Spoon mango puree into bottom of a bowl; top with yogurt
5. When ready to serve, top with cereal for a crunchy, sweet treat!
Child Serving: 1/4 - 1/2 cup mango yogurt parfait
1. Place all ingredients in a large bowl
2. Stir to mix the fruit together
3. Keep covered in the fridge for a quick, sweet snack
Child Serving: 1/4 - 1/2 cup tropical fruit salad
1. Wash pear under running water; dry
2. Slice pear in half, remove core
3. Cut pears into long slices like French fries and enjoy!
Variation: For "ketchup," use a tablespoon of your child\'s favorite low-fat yogurt!
1. Wash the pear, apple, and grapes under running water; pat dry
2. Cut fruit into small, bite-sized pieces
3. Toss with lemon juice and cover, if storing in the fridge
Child Serving: 1/4 - 1/2 cup sweet \'n crisp fruit jumble
1. Place the tortilla on a plate
2. Place cheese on half of the tortilla
3. Add mushrooms and spinach on top of the cheese
5. Microwave on high until cheese is melted (about 30-45 seconds)
Note: Be sure to let the quesadilla cool. The cheese in the tortillas stays HOT for a few minutes!
1. With a small sharp knife, carefully stab the sweet potato in several spots (go about 1/2 inch deep)
2. Microwave sweet potato on high for 2 1/2 minutes
3. Flip the sweet potato and microwave until soft (about 1-2 more minutes; time will vary depending on size of the sweet potato)
4. When cool enough to touch, remove sweet potato skin with a small sharp knife
5. Place sweet potato flesh, butter, and cinnamon in a large bowl and mash with a fork
Child Serving: 1/4 - 1/2 cup sweet potato mash
Note: Sweet potato will be HOT coming out of the microwave. Use caution when handling!
1. Cut off stem of the butternut squash
2. Cut butternut squash in half lengthwise
3. Scoop out seeds; place butternut squash in a microwave-safe container
4. Add orange juice (or water) to where you scooped out the seeds
5. Cover and microwave on high until squash is soft (about 8 minutes); let cool for 2 minutes
6. Scoop out the squash; mash squash with fork or serve as bite-size chunks
Note: Butternut squash will be HOT coming out of the microwave. Use caution when handling!
2. Slice collards into thin, small ribbons
3. Place sliced greens and water (or broth) in a large microwave-safe bowl
4. Cover with a microwave-safe plate or lid and microwave on high until soft (3-4 minutes)
Note: Collard greens will be HOT coming out of the microwave. Use caution when handling!
Variations: Add your favorite spices to the collards for a different kick!
1. Combine tuna or chicken and low-fat mayo
2. Cut tomato in half and scoop out seeds
3. Fill each tomato half with tuna or chicken mixture
4. Stand carrot stick (or bell pepper strip) up in the tuna or chicken
5. Attach the lettuce as a sail and enjoy your boat!
Note: This recipe is fun for children to put together, but raw vegetables can be hard for young children to chew well. When it\'s time to eat, be sure to cut into thin, bite-sized pieces!
1. Cut the bread into a circle, using a cup as a guide
2. Spread cream cheese on bread circle
3. Use banana slices for nose and ears
4. Cut grape in half and use as eyes
5. Slice strawberry lengthwise and use as teeth!
Note: This recipe is fun for children to put together. When it\'s time to eat, be sure to cut into bite-sized pieces!
